content: Egypt on Fire
, the Master, spoke to me: “Son of man, preach. Give them the Message of , the Master. Wail:
“‘Doomsday!’
Thick clouds are rolling in.
Death will rain down on Egypt.
When they see the Egyptians killed,
And Ethiopia, Put, Lud, Arabia, Libya
“‘ says:
“‘Egypt’s allies will fall
From Migdol in the north to Syene in the south,
Egypt, most desolate of the desolate,
Will realize that I am
“‘When that happens, I’ll send out messengers by ship to sound the alarm among the easygoing Ethiopians. They’ll be terrorized. Egypt’s doomed! Judgment’s coming!
“‘, the Master, says:
“‘I’ll put a stop to Egypt’s arrogance.
He and his army, the most brutal of nations,
They’ll brandish their swords
I’ll dry up the Nile
I’ll hire outsiders to come in
“‘And now this is what , the Master, says:
“‘I’ll smash all the no-god idols;
The prince of Egypt will be gone for good,
I’ll demolish Pathros,
Pour my wrath on Pelusium, Egypt’s fort,
I’ll set Egypt on fire:
Thebes blown away,
The young warriors of On and Pi-beseth
A dark day for Tahpanhes
When I break Egyptian power
She’ll disappear in a cloud of dust,
That’s how I’ll punish Egypt,
In the eleventh year, on the seventh day of the first month, ’s Message came to me:
“Son of man, I’ve broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt. And look! It hasn’t been set. No splint has been put on it so the bones can knit and heal, so he can use a sword again.

“Therefore, , the Master, says, I am dead set against Pharaoh king of Egypt and will go ahead and break his other arm—both arms broken! There’s no way he’ll ever swing a sword again. I’ll scatter Egyptians all over the world. I’ll make the arms of the king of Babylon strong and put my sword in his hand, but I’ll break the arms of Pharaoh and he’ll groan like one who is mortally wounded. I’ll make the arms of the king of Babylon strong, but the arms of Pharaoh shall go limp. The Egyptians will realize that I am  when I place my sword in the hand of the king of Babylon. He’ll wield it against Egypt and I’ll scatter Egyptians all over the world. Then they’ll realize that I am .”
